remarks: Property of a disjoint collection: if ` B ( X ) = C ` and ` B ( Y ) = D ` have a common element ` Z ` , then ` X = Y ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Nov-2016.)
statement:
disji.1 $e |- ( x = X -> B = C ) $.
disji.2 $e |- ( x = Y -> B = D ) $.
disji $p |- ( ( Disj_ x e. A B /\ ( X e. A /\ Y e. A ) /\ ( Z e. C /\ Z e. D ) ) -> X = Y ) $.
$d A x $.
$d C x $.
$d D x $.
$d X x $.
$d Y x $.
